ygData.subject: Re: Roleplaying server
ygData.msgSnippet: I play on the FV server, I love it, I am a 56 cleric on there and will be glad to help you out, just send me a tell in game, let me know you saw the post, will
ygData.messageBody:
I play on the FV server, I love it, I am a 56 cleric on there and
will be glad to help you out, just send me a tell in game, let me
know you saw the post, will help get you started as well, so hope ot
see you soon, Bitz 56 cleric, <perilous endeavors>- In
EverQuest@yahoogroups.com, Su <suceress@d...> wrote:
>
>
> > Hi. I've been dabbling with the idea of checking out one of the
> Roleplaying
> > EQ servers and I was just wondering how they differ from regular
servers.
> > Has anyone here tried them out before? What were your
experiences like?
> >
> > Chris
> >
> I played on FV a teeny bit. Trivial loot is gay. I was grouped
with someone
> close enough to the same level as me so I would get xp with him.
We went to
> fight a mob that was dark blue to him. It took us a looong time to
kill the
> mob and when we finally did it, it said that the mob was "trivial"
to my
> "group". So it didn't even drop loot. Totally sucked.
> Also, there is no "common" language. You start out with your
native tongue
> and people can't understand you if they speak a different
language. There is
> no /ooc channel. People use auction but auction advertises in your
native
> language. Even tells are sent in your starting language (unless
you set it
> to another language but you pretty much start out at 0 in other
languages).
> You don't get any alts on the server either.
> It's kindof cool and there's some neat stuff. There isn't much no
drop stuff
> on the servers and it can be fun to roleplay.
> Some author named R.A. Salvatore plays a wizard named Kimmuriel on
FV. So I
> guess he likes it.
> luv,
> -Su
